body.p:
Armory "Grey's Battalion"
Madison Ind, Jan 12t 1861.
Sir
I am authorized to render you the services of the above named corps to aid in quelling servile disturbances or to defend our sister state from Aboltion raids of any kind or description.
We can bring about 118 rifles, with the proper quota of officers, into the field
Saturated as we are, with communication by steam ferry with Kentucky, we feel that should the exigence arise, we could make ourselves useful
Orders from you, per mail or Telelgraph, will receive prompt attention and obedience

With sentiments of high respect
I remain &C.
Wm R. Davidson Co. A.
Sec. G. B.
Box 151 P. O.

His Excellency
Gov B. Magoffin
Frankfort
Ky.

P. S,
Our Commandant and Major, Mssrs Bachman and Shrewsbury, are cadets from K. M. I. at Frankfort.
